Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2008 06:53PM mswkelly76 wrote: Hey sumbunny- I am 32 years old, and my story is almost identical to yours-(although my tumor is a tiny bit smaller, and the surgeon says she sees another couple tumors developing).....they told me the same thing, irregular borders, solid tumor, some small groups of microcalcifications around the tumor-they did a core needle biopsy, and it came back benign, but aren't happy with that based on the "irregularity" of the tumor-5 women in my family have breast cancer-so, I am scheduled for lumpectomy October 1st-am hoping for the best, hard to stay optimistic......hopefully, all will go well for us both, this seems to be a great site for support! :)  Wishing you well.... Kelly
Posts.Title: toally nervous sumbunny sbmolee

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2008 07:27PM mswkelly76 wrote: Hey, I am having similar experience that Lucy had-you have to do what feels right for you, I am getting a lumpectomy in October also, even though my biopsy came back benign-I have long family history, and am concerned if I leave tumor in there it will develop into a problem-plus, my surgeon was saying that biopsys can miss the cancer cells about 20-30 percent of the time-good luck to you! :)
Posts.Title: Benign biopsies-should I get lump removed? gstf344 Lucy47

Posts.Content: mswkelly76 wrote: Hello all, Have posted in a few places, waiting to go for surgery on the 1st of October for a tumor (or 3) that are in my left breast-I have a BIRADS 4, and both the radiologist and surgeon are concerned about the tumor because it is not "typical" of a benign tumor.....some microcalcifications around the edge, and irregular borders-they initially thought it was fibroadenoma, then they thought it was a hamartoma, but the reports all state that they are do not look typical of either, and then there says there is "Fibroadenomatous change"........has anyone else had this in their reports?  I am guessing that it menas something like it kind of looks like a fibroadenoma but not really?  I am getting whole mess removed for testing, 5 women in my family with breast cancer-luckily, I have a fabulous surgeon, and feel very confident I will be ok, but the whole situation is soooooo scary......thanks in advance for any feedback! :) Kelly Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Fibroadenomatous change? mswkelly76 mswkelly76
